column4: does anyone know why the pid stored in a pid file would consistently be two less than the actual pid of the daemon?  (the daemon is being started by start-stop-daemon)  If I had to guess I'd say the pid is from the bash instance that starts start-stop-daemon, rather than the instance of the daemon itself.  Can anyone confirm this?
Interesting issue, did you search bug reports in LaunchPad yet for it?
nope, not yet, I suppose that'd be a good first step
If it's a known issue, likely there will be explanations in detail of why it hapens, etc etc
